artist: Artist: Jean Louis André Théodore Géricault; Printer: Charles Joseph Hullmandel
catalogue_raissonne: Delteil 41 II/II; Beraldi 33; Rouen, Géricault Complete Prints Exh. 33 II/II
creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund, 1966
inscription:
Engraved inscriptions, lower margin: LL: J, Gericault invt.; LC: A FRENCH FARRIER; LR: C. hullmandel Lithography.

Inscribed in pencil, LC margin: Le Marechal ferrant francois
markings: Two unknown collectors stamps in violet ink, verso
portfolio: From Various Subjects Drawn from Life on Stone
text: Théodore Géricault made countless drawings, paintings, watercolors, and prints of horses. This image of a farrier at work shoeing horses belongs to a series of lithographs of everyday life. They illustrate the intimate relationship between man and beast—in which human dominance is not a given.
title: A French Farrier
